posts.content: Excellent thanks Ted, think mine only came with one cupboard too, hopefully one of the bigger DICS will be along in a minute and tell us that was standard for the Caravette in 66

So is this is not the correct location for the mirror then on the driver's side? Every day's a school day.



The Spaceway has a wardrobe where the cooker side mirror mount would be. It has a mirror fixed on the wardrobe itself. I haven't seen enough original ones to know if it has a standalone mirror too or where that would mount?

This is the 1966 brochure, I can't quite make out for definite whether it has both cupboards on a standard caravette but I think it does from what I can see; maybe someone with a better screen can confirm or deny?
http://www.devonmoonraker.pwp.blueyonde ... ochure.pdf

Awaiting the bigger DICS...

Spaceway interior has the mount right next to the driver's side rear cupboard as shown above. The second mount is on the rear cargo door so that you could shave outside with the bowl on a small table fixed to the door. These are the original postions for the 65 - 67 Spaceways but I'm not sure if earlier versions had the mounts in the same places.

Ah...mmm
Ted's cupboard has a non standard bracket under it with a ...ummm very nice,,,,ummm shape.

Yes the customer could add cupboards at order or even later..At one time you could take your bus for them to fit an interior into with what you wanted where you wanted it within reason...
I have never measured cupboard lengths...There are a lot of differences over the years though..
That will be an addition to "the knowledge"

"We have two Caravettes
A Septemeber 64 and a January 65...so both 65 MY...Both had the standard cooker position and mirror position..

Spaceways... I am still learning.. I have the brochures and the instruction manuals but I have not owned one...when you do own one you crawl all over them and get to know them inside and out.
